result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl Blackmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Release privileges for the Day Reporting Center, work and treatment.

miscConds.notes: No driving without a valid driver's license.

Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Restitution set at zero.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
Provide DNA sample.  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid over a period  of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms; and he is unable to vote in any election until  civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl Blackmon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
Effective date:   07-02-2014        Initials:  AAC
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan; signed and filed.

Defendant Earl Blackmon in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Earl Blackmon IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Additional statements made by the defendant.

AS TO COUNT #1: THE COURT ORDERED the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction; with release priviledges for Day Reporting Center, work, and treatment; with credit for 80 days pretrial incarceraton credit.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with supervision by Wisconsin Department of Corrections. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant's driver operating priviledges are REVOKED for 20 months from today's date. 
* No driving without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for 16 MONTHS from today's date.
* Restitution is set at ZERO.

FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
FILED, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
FILED, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Earl Blackmon in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Earl Blackmon IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. 

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
filed by ADA Catelin Ringersma on behalf of the State.  Count #1 REMAINS THE SAME.  The amendment is to add the ignition interlock device language.

Defendant Earl Blackmon in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Earl Blackmon IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea Hearing today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
State requests an adjournment; State needs to complete victim notification and prepare an amended information.
Court GRANTS request.
Defense requests to address bail.
Defense moves to modify bail again.
State objects.
Arguments heard.
Court DENIED defense motion to modify bail.
Case adjourned to 04-02-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Earl Blackmon not in court, IN CUSTODY.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for a scheduling conference/bail bond hearing.
Parties are still under negotiations and request a projected plea hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
Court addressed bail:  Parties stipulate to a bail reduction in the amount of $1,500.00.
COURT'S RULING:  Based upon the stipulation of the parties, Court REDUCED the bail amount to $1,500.00 and if posted, defendant to be TURNED OVER TO  Wisconsin Correctional Services / In House Correctional Services for supervision.  Court orders the following conditions of release:  (1)  SCRAM (2)  Breathalyzer testing (3)  Absolute sobriety/no controlled substances (4)  No driving without a valid driver's license (5) Cooperate and Participate in the Repeated intoxicated driver program.
Case adjourned to 03-11-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

FILED, signed Pretrial Release Conditions Order (Copy forwarded to WCS for processing).

Defendant Earl Blackmon in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Earl Blackmon in custody.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.
  No driving without a valid license.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Earl Blackmon in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Earl Blackmon in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
AODA Assessment Form placed in Court File.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
